Title: Real Estate Portfolio Administrator
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Portfolio Administration team is a crucial function within the DoorDash Finance team that sits on the Workplace, Facilities and Real Estate organization. This team manages the overall operations of our facilities and the Portfolio Administration team is critical in ensuring all lease data is accurately abstracted, reported, and communicated.
About the Role
DoorDash is looking for a Real Estate Portfolio Administrator to report to the Associate Manager, Portfolio Administration. In this role, you will manage all lease obligations and support the scaling of our diverse real estate portfolio, as we expand and evolve to support our business. 
You will need to be a master at handling multiple tasks and projects with a no-job-is-too-small attitude, an ability to take thoughtful initiative, and the desire to go above and beyond. 
You will ensure compliance in lease reporting, auditing and approving lease abstractions, assist with portfolio planning, and other ongoing portfolio management activities to maintain accurate records utilizing systems and software in place. You will ensure data is reported accurately with the ability to generate, analyze, and distribute ad-hoc reports.
This role will require exceptional communication and organizational skills, strong attention to detail, resourcefulness, and the ability to work well with a diverse range of cross functional partners. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be a critical team member in the management of our expanding global portfolio, including tracking critical dates and driving strategic real estate decisions.
Review and approve new lease/amendment abstractions to ensure 100% accuracy in our lease database and administration system. 
Partner with our Construction Management team to review Construction timelines to ensure recovery of all TIA.
Work closely with Lease Accounting to ensure full sox and FASB 842 compliance. 
Work with Landlords, Transaction Management and Construction teams on assorted post-lease documentation including Commencement Date Agreements, Estoppels & SNDAs. 
Contact Landlord regarding maintenance and repair issues related to the building and common areas that are Landlord's responsibility under the Lease and monitor the progress.
Coordinate sublease projects with subTT and obtain Landlord approval.
Provide ownership responsibilities to all Cross Functional Partners (Facilities, Construction, Security, Lease Accounting)  per the Lease.
Work with legal to resolve interpretation discrepancies, and issue notices to Landlords.
Work with Lease Accounting to issue invoices applicable to the Lease language.
Interact with Landlords in order to facilitate completion of paperwork required under the Lease, and walk them through the provisions, if necessary.
Establish timely deadlines with the Landlord for self-help rights if not established in the lease and inform Facilities of expectations.
Monitor and collect reimbursements from Landlords for lease cap, self-help and security deposits.
Work alongside internal and external audit teams to ensure a seamless and successful audit process.
Foster strong relationships with cross-functional partners and ensure alignment across the organization.
Report and monitor Critical dates for lease/option renewals, terminations and other key milestones.
Partner and hold our third party vendor accountable to the reconciliation of monthly payments.
Partner with our third party vendor as needed to research and resolve payment disputes with Landlords.
Liaise with multiple teams; Real Estate Transaction, Lease Accounting, Facilities, Construction,  Legal, Procurement, Risk & Insurance and our third party team.
Support the preparation of monthly portfolio metric reporting.
Support special projects and assignments as required.
Develop and maintain process playbooks.
Review and audit CAM reconciliations.

Were excited about you because you...

Are Customer Obsessed with a passionate drive to, take initiative, and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.
Think big, and Start Small with a thoughtful process of analyzing data and circumstances to solve problems and reach a well-reasoned solution.
Value our One Team, One Fight mentality by partnering effectively to execute on our common goals in a pleasant and energetic manner.
Have a Bias for Action with an appreciation and understanding of our mission in order to make sound, timely contributions.
Strive to be 1% Better Everyday with your openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.
Choose Optimism and Have a Plan, whether it's a big project or impromptu task, you are quick on your feet and happy to contribute in a helpful, organized way.
Be an owner, no problem is too big, too small or outside of your scope. You always jump in and help.
Operate at the lowest level of detail, You are a detail-oriented individual who thrives on managing deadlines and accurately performing your work. 
Have a strong understanding of lease agreements, terminology, lease accounting principles. 
Have 3+ years of experience managing a global real estate portfolio. You bring expertise and understanding of commercial leases including extensive exposure to office and commercial portfolios. 
Have a bachelors degree or equivalent work experience
Expertise in understanding and interpreting complex lease language and CAM charges
Proficiency with lease database tools
Understanding of legal terminology as it pertains to leases and real estate
Ability to understand, abstract, and communicate lease requirements to stakeholders
Excellent written, verbal, analytical, and research skills required
Salesforce, Smartsheets, LeaseCalc, Google Suite experience a plus 

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are strategic - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. 
We are learning - Were not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if its scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if weve been in a role for one year or one minute.
We are customer-obsessed - We are committed to our clients and connected through our vision of Delivering Good
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights. 
We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits
You will be proud to say that you work for DoorDash and will know that the work you do brings joy to our clients every day

Title: Manager, Creative Lead, Art Director
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Superette is DoorDashs award-winning in-house creative studio. We create work thats sharp, memorable, and part of the conversation, blurring the lines between brand and culture, storytelling and utility, entertainment and effectiveness.
We exist to build a brand people actually care about. One that shows up meaningfully across every touchpoint and earns its place in culture through creativity that hits hard and sticks. Our studio is stacked with some of the best talent in the game, and our ambition is simple: raise the bar with every brief.
In 2024, we were named the #2 in-house studio by The One Show and The Drum. DoorDash landed on Fast Companys Brands That Matter list, US Weeklys Top 50 Hottest Brands, and was ranked one of the Top 10 Most Creative Brands in the World by Cannes Lions. And were just getting started.
About the Role
Were looking for an ideas-first Creative Lead / Art Direction background. Someone who starts with a strong concept, not just aesthetics, and takes full ownership of the work from start to finish. This is a hands-on senior creative role for someone who wants to be in the work, not managing from the sidelines. Youll be one of the senior creatives in the studio, shaping campaigns that move fast, stand out, and leave a mark on culture.
You have a sharp eye for visual storytelling and design. You know how to define the look and feel of a campaign in a way thats both bold and cohesive. Youre just as comfortable working on large-scale productions as you are creating something powerful on your own. Big budgets arent a requirement for you to make something great; youre proactive, hands-on, and always pushing the work forward. You dont wait for the perfect brief,  you understand the brand, spot the opportunity, and come up with smart, creative solutions that move the needle.
You embrace AI as a creative tool that expands whats possible. Youll collaborate with writers, designers, producers, and teams across Brand and Social to craft work that drives real business results while pushing creative standards forward. If you bring fresh, original ideas, obsess over craft, and want to create work people actually talk about, this role is for you.
You will report to our Co-Heads of Creative, Rafael Segri and Julio Dalfonso, within Superette, DoorDashs In-House studio. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Work on projects that feel worthy of a top place in your portfolio.
Have a lot of autonomy to run projects and grow as a leader.
Develop campaigns with the best partners in the industry, who are all eager to work for DoorDash and help shape our brand.
No pitches. No timesheets.
Dive deep into the brand to create work that not only reaches the highest creative bar but also drives meaningful results.
Experience a different approach to work compared to traditional advertising agencies.
Go beyond, making ads to create experiences, content, product enhancements, and solutions that solve our audiences real problems.
Work at an intense pace during your day, but will have a good work/life balance
Collaborate with a team of talented writers, art directors, designers, and social strategists who deeply understand our business and audiences.
Fully-remote (within the US) 

Were excited about you because...

Youve got a portfolio full of smart, well-crafted, famous work that broke into culture.
Proven track record in creating and leading high-impact, award-winning campaigns that drive brand recognition and love
Youve done TV/film that youre proud of, but youre mostly excited about big ideas regardless of the medium they live in  whether that is clever activations, social content, brand entertainment or anything else that earns free media.
Youre amazing at your craftan exceptional art director with a sharp eye and obsessive attention to detail. Whether its building decks, scouting a DP, or crafting the visual identity for a campaign, you dont stop until everything is pixel-perfect.
Ability to push creative boundaries while maintaining high production standards and a consistent brand aesthetic.
Youre an ad nerd.
Youre proactive by nature  you dont wait to be asked, you spot opportunities and make things happen.
You embrace change. What worked yesterday might not work today  you stay curious, adapt fast, and keep up with new tools, platforms, and creative possibilities.
You stay on top of cultural trends, always trying to find the sweet spot where a brand connects with peoples lives and interests.
Youre passionate about sports, or entertainment, or pop culture, or all of them combined.
You dont work in isolationyou love collaborating with people from all departments in the organization.

Title: Machine Learning Intern (PhD only), Fall 2025
Location: San Francisco, CA; Seattle, WA; Sunnyvale, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash is building the worlds most reliable on-demand logistics engine for delivery! Were looking for machine learning engineer interns to join our fast-growing engineering team to help us develop a 24x7 global infrastructure system that powers DoorDashs three-sided marketplace of consumers, merchants, and dashers.
About the Role
As a Machine Learning Engineer intern at Doordash, youll work on tackling new challenges in machine learning and artificial intelligence. Youll conduct research that can be applied across Doordash engineering teams and engage in external collaborations and mentoring, while also performing research in any of the following areas: Auction, Game theory, Recommender systems, Ranking, AdTech, Computer Vision, Causal Inference, and Big data analytics. We offer a 12-week fall internship program in our San Francisco, Sunnyvale, or Seattle offices running from September-December with potential extension to a spring internship.
 Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Use cutting-edge research in  ML/AI, NLP, RecSys, Ranking, Computer Vision, Causal Inference,  Ad Tech, Graph analysis to solve real-world  problems across discovery, ads,forecasting, fulfillment  and search experiences at Doordash.
Contribute and execute on research ideas that can be applied and used to improve product experience at Doordash.
Collect, analyze, and synthesize findings from data and use these insights to build relevant ML models.
Write clean, efficient, and sustainable code

Were excited about you because you...

Are working towards a PhD degree in Computer Science, ML, NLP, Statistics, Information Sciences or related field and are graduating between Winter 2026 & Summer 2028
Have a mastery of at least one systems languages (Java, C++, Python, Kotlin, GoLang) or one ML framework (Tensorflow, Pytorch, MLFlow)
Have experience in research and in solving analytical problems
Are a strong communicator and team player.
Have a passion for applied ML and the Doordash product
Ideally have worked on publications in machine learning, AI, data science, data analytics, statistics, or related technical fields
Compensation

Title: DashMart Team Member - The Flats
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers

ead: You will help lead cross-functional work streams of Engineers, Data Scientists and Designers to develop best in class product features that will enhance the quality of New Vertical deliveries

Title: Sr. Manager, Project/Program Manager - Global Equity Programs
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Equity Team operates at the intersection of Accounting, HR, and Legal, which gives us a unique opportunity to create value across the organization.  We are in an exciting period of growth, working to create the framework to operate equity programs at scale for one of the fastest growing marketplace companies.
About the Role
At DoorDash, we move fast, solve real problems, and empower our teams to do the best work of their lives. Were looking for a driven, collaborative, and systems-minded Equity Operations leader to help shape and scale our equity programs as we grow globally. If you're passionate about building processes that just work and love partnering across functions to get stuff doneread on.
The Global Equity Team is looking for a Sr. Manager Global Equity Programs. This role will be responsible for overseeing the rapid growth and administration of the companys global equity programs, ensuring accuracy and compliance, optimizing systems and processes, and serving as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders and external partners. This individual will work cross-functionally with Legal, Finance, HR, Payroll, and external vendors to deliver a seamless equity experience for employees, executives, and board members globally. 
You will report to the Sr. Director, Global Equity Programs in our Accounting organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

You'll own relationships with critical external partnersbrokerage platforms, transfer agents, and payroll providersensuring seamless service delivery that supports both employees and business needs. 
Lead initiatives to upgrade our equity systems and ensure data accuracy. Youll identify gaps, propose solutions, and implement improvements with relentless curiosity and a bias toward action.
Partner with senior leaders in Legal, Finance, and People teams to design and iterate equity programs that reflect the evolving needs of our workforce. Your voice matters, and youll help shape company-wide programs that scale with us.
From expanding global equity operations to automating payroll and mobility reporting, youll lead key transformation projects with cross-functional partners to unlock efficiency and transparency across geographies.
Partner closely with our cross functional partners to navigate equity policies and taxation, ensuring compliance and governance globally. Youll keep our equity engine running smoothly and our stakeholders informed and protected.
Design and manage workflows and systems that deliver precision, speed, and clarity. Your work ensures our reporting is solid, our data is trusted, and our decisions are grounded.
With strong knowledge of domestic and international equity regulations, youll help us anticipate whats coming and build sustainable compliance infrastructure that scales.
Youll thrive in ambiguity, juggle competing priorities, and make smart decisions quickly. You're decisive, adaptable, and know how to move the needle when it counts.

Why This Role Matters
The work is not just stock operationsyoull be helping thousands of employees around the globe understand and benefit from their equity. Youll streamline the systems that support one of our most important employee programs, helping DoorDash remain a great place to build and grow.
Were excited about you because...

You are a senior level manager with 8+ years of experience in stock plan administration
You operate like an owner. You are self-motivated, reliable, flexible, and can drive progress under tight deadlines.
You have exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
You have a strong track record of achievement.
You have a strong tendency toward cross-functional relationship building and a bias toward action.
You can distill complex concepts into simple, easy to understand communications.
Youre comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels and communicating effectively and efficiently.
You are capable of identifying and resolving issues before they surface 
You have very strong Excel skills
CEP certification is preferred
Knowledge of Workday, ADP, and the Shareworks/EEO platform a huge plus
Deep knowledge of equity accounting and operating in international jurisdictions.

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash
We are leaders  Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are operators  We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions to lead our company and our industry is what we do on every project, every day. 
We are learners  Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if weve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our customers, merchants, and dashers.
We are one team  The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.
We expect this position to be filled by 9/16/25

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs is an independent team within DoorDash. We explore robotics and automation to transform last-mile logistics in the long term. If you have a passion for applying autonomous aviation technologies in a service used by millions of people, then we want to talk to you!
About the Role
This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the future of drone delivery by supporting high-impact operations at the intersection of technology and logistics.
As an Operations Associate, youll play a critical role in ensuring the reliability and efficiency of our drone operations. You'll monitor data and dashboards to spot trends, identify issues, and support decisions with actionable insights. Youll help test and implement new workflows, contribute to operational playbooks, and provide on-the-ground support during site launches.
This is a hybrid role based in the Bay Area, with regular in-person collaboration and frequent international travel to support both new launches and ongoing operations at active drone delivery sites.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Communicate with Clarity: Whether you're logging bugs, writing SOPs, or training new team members, youre clear, concise, and thoughtful in how you share information.
Thrive in Operations: Youve worked in live ops environments and know how to stay calm, focused, and effectiveespecially when things get messy or ambiguous.
Adapt Quickly: You're comfortable navigating the unknown, quick to ask smart questions, and resourceful when solving problems in new settings.
Obsess Over the Details: You care about doing things the right wayexecuting with accuracy, consistency, and a high bar for quality.
Are Data-Driven: You use SQL and dashboards to monitor performance, identify patterns, and drive continuous improvement grounded in data.
Understand the Importance of Compliance: Youre mindful of operational rules and regulationsespecially in new marketsand work with precision to support safe, compliant drone operations.

Were excited about you because...

You Turn Data into Action: Youre confident in SQL and dashboards, not just for tracking performancebut for identifying issues early and helping teams make better, faster decisions.
You Build Operational Tools That Scale: Youve created SOPs, checklists, and workflows that are built for the real world. Theyre clear, reliable, and designed to hold up under pressure as operations grow.
You Know How to Lead on the Ground: With experience managing people or workstreams, you know how to set priorities, align with others, and keep execution on trackeven in fast-changing environments
Youre Comfortable Operating Across Borders: Youve worked with teams or vendors across time zones and understand how to stay aligned, communicate clearly, and solve problems without delay.
Youre Eager to Learn the Drone Space: You may not be a drone expert yet, but youre genuinely excited about autonomy. Youre ready to dive into the technology, understand the regulations, and help shape how drones operate safely and reliably at scale.

Title: Associate Manager, Digital Ordering - Strategy & Operations
Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA; Denver, CO
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Digital Ordering is DoorDashs first software-as-a-service business unit  offering a suite of services across online ordering, branded mobile apps, loyalty solutions, and more that enable restaurants to reach customers through their own first-party channels.
The business is one of the fastest-growing segments within DoorDash, and yet is only scratching the surface of a generational opportunity to better serve hundreds of thousands of merchants across the Americas to help them grow their business and improve working lives in one of the countrys biggest industry sectors.
As part of the Strategy & Operations team focused on our restaurant segment, the Associate Manager will have the opportunity to help define and lead key strategic initiatives to grow the business. Your work will be instrumental to helping transition DoorDash from a consumer marketplace to an industry-leading B2B SaaS company.
On a typical day, youll work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Operations to grow our SaaS suite and drive merchant success. Youll design and test new GTM motions and synthesize insights from merchants and frontline teams to influence product and strategy. Whether youre running experiments, analyzing data to uncover growth levers, or building internal processes to help teams move faster together  youll be at the center of scaling what works.
About the Role
As an Associate Manager on the Digital Ordering Strategy & Operations team, youll be at the forefront of building DoorDashs SaaS business into a category-defining platform for restaurants. This role is ideal for a strategic operator who can move fast and wear many hats  equal parts analyst, builder, operator, and GTM partner.
Youll own zero-to-one experiments, craft growth strategies for our first-party products (ordering, websites, loyalty, mobile apps), and work directly with frontline sales and product teams to help merchants thrive. If you thrive in ambiguous environments, know how to test and scale new ideas, and want to help local businesses win, we want to hear from you.
Were especially excited about candidates whove worked in fast-moving, founder-led, or resource-constrained environments  those who see lack of structure as an opportunity to build.
Your responsibilities will include:

Grow the product line: Partner with Product, Marketing, and Sales to grow our first-party SaaS suite  spanning online ordering, websites, apps, and loyalty  by building high-impact enablement materials (pitch decks, sales plays, trainings), launching new GTM motions, and acting as the connective tissue across teams to ensure feedback loops inform strategy and product development.
Impact:  Act as the voice of the merchant and the field, synthesizing feedback from frontline Sales, Onboarding, Support, and Operations to help influence product roadmaps and GTM priorities. You'll ensure our solutions resonate with customers and scale with repeatable excellence.
Analyze:  Pair complex data analysis with qualitative insights from internal teams and customers to guide strategic decisions, GTM launches, and content development. Youll translate insight into action that improves both merchant experience and internal execution.
Experiment: Design and launch zero-to-one experiments that test new GTM motions and pilot AI-powered tools  building demos, prototype AI agents, or configure internal tooling that improves speed, accuracy, or effectiveness in go-to-market efforts.
Scale learnings:  Codify what works. Build repeatable frameworks, processes, and training to drive GTM excellence across the org. You'll define best practices for launching new products and motions in a way thats scalable and measurable.

The best candidates will:

Bring strong analytical horsepower and intellectual curiosity  you're comfortable diving into complex data and extracting insights that drive real-world decisions
Think like a founder  scrappy, resourceful, and driven to solve hard problems with limited structure or direction
Thrive in fast-paced, high-ambiguity environments  you move with urgency, default to action, take ownership end-to-end, and know when to bend process to get things done
Have experience working closely with Sales or frontline teams and know how to turn insights from those teams into action
Demonstrate comfort with AI, automation, or internal tooling to drive process efficiency, enable scale, or prototype solutions
Are relationship builders who foster deep trust and collaboration across functions - able to build strong relationships with our Sales, Account Management, Product, Engineering teams
Communicate clearly and adapt their message depending on audience  whether summarizing insights for leadership or rolling up sleeves with field teams

Bonus if youve:

Worked in zero-to-one or early-stage environments
Been a founder or built something from scratch
Are the first in your family to attend college
Worked in or adjacent to restaurant tech, SMBs, or SaaS

You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build deep and meaningful relationships with merchants, laser focused on helping them thrive
Imagine, develop, and execute on workstreams from start to completion with little oversight 
Oscillate easily from strategic considerations to tactical execution 
Operate comfortably in ambiguous environments while maintaining a strong bias for action
Communicate precisely dependent on audience and level of detail necessary to share 
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional team members across the organization
Represent the DoorDash brand with humility and a customer-first mindset

We're excited about you because you...

46 years of experience in consulting, strategy, business operations, sales, business development, growth, or SaaS technology roles
Proven ability to lead cross-functional initiatives  from identifying opportunities to executing with Product, Sales, and Marketing teams
Experience in high-growth or complex environments, with a track record of navigating ambiguity and driving outcomes
Strong analytical skills; advanced Excel required, SQL proficiency preferred
Exceptional written and verbal communication, with the ability to tailor messaging across audiences (e.g., sales reps, execs, and merchants)

Bonus if you have experience with:

Piloting or working with AI tools in real-world workflows
Zero-to-one work (startups, early-stage teams, or founder-like roles)
Supporting products or GTM motions in restaurant or SMB SaaS
Bachelor's degree required

We expect this position to be filled by 9/29/25.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Consumer Promotions team drives value for customers by developing strategic seasonal and evergreen promotional campaigns that help users discover and try new restaurants, products, and services across DoorDash. We measure success by how effectively and efficiently these campaigns drive growth, enhance customer experience, and support business priorities across lines of businessincluding the US Marketplace, New Verticals, and DashPass.
About the Role
DoorDash is seeking a Senior Manager, Consumer Promotions Strategy & Campaign Operations to lead our promotional strategy across our core business units. This leader will define the vision for high-impact, measurable promotionsbalancing business goals with customer value, and enabling scalable growth across US Marketplace, New Verticals (e.g., Grocery, Retail), and DashPass.
You will be responsible for forecasting and sizing promotional opportunities, creating standard measurement and governance frameworks, and promoting consistent adoption of strategic best practices across functions. Youll leverage data, AI, and experimentation to evolve personalization, targeting, and campaign structures. This is a highly cross-functional leadership role reporting to the Head of Campaign Operations and overseeing a 10+ person team.
You're excited about this opportunity because...
Lead Strategy & Gain Organizational Buy-in

Define and articulate the long-term vision for consumer promotions aligned to the unique growth goals of US Marketplace, New Verticals, and DashPass.
Build followership for strategic best practices by aligning stakeholders across Product, Marketing, Finance, and Operations.
Champion the adoption of scalable promotional principles and frameworks that align incentives and streamline decision-making.

Drive Forecasting & Campaign Sizing

Lead promotional forecasting efforts in collaboration with Finance and Analytics, ensuring that campaign plans are tightly scoped, measurable, and tied to clear ROI expectations.
Own end-to-end sizing of promotional investmentsfrom customer-level incentive design to enterprise-level budget allocationbalancing cost efficiency and strategic impact.

Enable AI-Powered Personalization & Testing

Identify and champion opportunities to use AI and predictive analytics to tailor promotions by audience, cohort, and channel.
Partner with Product, Data Science, and Engineering to implement experimentation infrastructure, enabling rapid A/B testing and ongoing performance refinement.

Standardize Measurement & Centralize Governance

Collaborate with Data Science and Performance Marketing to develop standardized methodologies for promotion attribution and impact measurement across omnichannel campaigns.
Design and manage centralized governance processes to ensure promotion consistency, prevent errors, and enforce cross-functional accountability.

Develop & Lead a High-Performing Team

Build and develop a team of Promotions Strategists and Analysts, focusing on analytical excellence, commercial acumen, and cross-functional leadership.
Foster a culture of ownership, continuous improvement, and results-driven experimentation.

Were excited about you because...

Experience: You bring 8+ years in consumer promotions, revenue strategy, growth marketing, or pricingwith 4+ years in people leadership roles.
Business Acumen: You have successfully led high-stakes strategy across diverse business lines with different customer behaviors and KPIs.
Technical Proficiency:  Experience working with Product and Engineering teams to improve capabilities of internal tools and customer-facing products. Excel proficiency required, ability to query databases with SQL a plus. 
Analytical Leadership: You are highly data-literate, with strong SQL and Excel skills, and have led teams through complex analysis and modeling efforts. You are fluent in forecasting and campaign sizing and have experience partnering with Finance, Product, and Analytics to quantify outcomes and investments.
AI & Innovation Focus: You understand how to use AI to drive personalization, targeting, and experimentation at scaleand are excited to shape whats next.
Cross-Functional Influence: You know how to influence across matrixed organizations and have a track record of gaining alignment to drive change with clear communication and cross-functional planning.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Merchant Live Order Experience team focuses on ensuring that every customer has a perfect delivery experience. We do this by partnering 1:1 with top US restaurant brands and local heroes as well as working closely with dashers to understand where there is opportunity for improvement, and then work through the entire product lifecycle with our Product and Analytics partners to identify and build new solutions to improve quality before driving adoption of those products with Merchants. About the Role
Were looking for a motivated Senior Associate to dive into strategy and execution to improve one of our core quality metrics. Youll get to the lowest level of detail by visiting Merchants, talking to Dashers, and reviewing our internal data and ultimately use that information to develop hypotheses for new ways to improve operations. Youll test these hypotheses in-market through hacky experiments, see what sticks, and scale top bets throughout the platform. This is a unique opportunity to be at the nexus of Logistics, Merchant Operations, Product, and Strategy. You will report into the Senior Manager on our Merchant Live Order Experience team in our Merchant Strategy and Operations organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Use data-driven decision-making to run and scale experiments on everything from implementing pick-up racks at Merchants to developing new incentive models for Merchants and their staff
Work with a cross-functional team including Merchant Account Managers, B2B Marketing, Analytics, Product and more to bring your projects to life
Operate at the lowest level of detail to understand the impact of your decisions and iterate given insights from data
Engage and cultivate relationships with Merchants to understand their needs and identify strategic bets that can create step-change improvements for them

Were excited about you because...

You want to affect change every day and can operate in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment
You love thinking about problems from a first principles approach, and are excited to take action, dig into the details, and try new things in order to create future solutions
You have experience working on analytical projects (proficiency in SQL is a plus) and are eager to get to the lowest level of detail to pull out valuable insights
You have strong written and verbal communication skills 
You thrive working in a cross-functional environment, and have had success leading projects across teams
You have completed your Bachelors degree and have 4+ years of experience in consulting, strategy, operations, technology, or related experience

Title: Global TA Tech Strategy & Operations Program Lead
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Talent Acquisition Strategy & Operations (S&O) team is evolving into a critical strategic partner, driving global recruiting efficiency and scalability, with a specialized focus on technical talent acquisition. We are dedicated to optimizing processes, implementing cutting-edge technology solutions, and leveraging advanced data analytics to align technical talent acquisition with DoorDash's and Wolt's evolving engineering and product development needs. Our mission is to empower technical recruiters with streamlined operations and data-driven insights, ensuring we attract, engage, and retain top-tier engineering talent globally.
About the Role
This role will require you to be based out of an East Coast time zone.
As a Global TA Tech Strategy & Operations Program Lead, you will be instrumental in leading strategic initiatives that standardize and optimize global recruiting practices specifically for Engineering and Product profiles. In your first 90 days, you will deeply immerse yourself in understanding our current technical hiring processes, building strong relationships with engineering leadership and technical recruiting teams, and contributing to ongoing RPO implementation with a focus on technical talent delivery. Success in this role will be measured by improved time-to-hire for engineering roles, enhanced quality of technical hires, optimized technical recruiter productivity, and the successful delivery of TA tech-focused projects. This role offers a unique opportunity to drive significant impact by transforming our global technical talent acquisition strategy. You will report into the Senior Manager of Recruitment Strategy and Operations on our RecOps team within our People and Culture organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead and manage strategic projects focused on optimizing the technical talent acquisition lifecycle, driving process improvements and implementing global best practices across diverse engineering and product development verticals.
Lead and manage the planning cycles for each Engineering and Product business vertical you own, aligning TA tech strategies with critical hiring roadmaps and organizational growth.
Analyze complex technical recruiting data (e.g., source effectiveness for specific tech stacks, offer acceptance rates by engineering level/specialty, pipeline velocity for critical roles, diversity within tech hiring pipelines) to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making for engineering talent acquisition.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Engineering leadership, People Analytics, and IT/HRIS teams to optimize recruiting technologies (e.g., applicant tracking systems, CRM, technical assessment platforms, coding challenge tools, interview scheduling automation) and streamline global processes for technical hiring.
Establish and maintain a robust rhythm of business, including developing and delivering regular reporting mechanisms such as Weekly Business Reviews (WBRs), Monthly Business Reviews (MBRs), and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) specifically focused on key performance indicators for technical talent acquisition.
Provide timely and insightful weekly "weather reports" to senior leadership, offering a clear overview of the technical hiring vertical's performance, highlighting key trends in engineering talent markets, and proactively addressing potential risks or opportunities related to tech talent acquisition.
Contribute to the implementation of our global RPO strategy, including vendor selection and program rollout, with a specific focus on integrating RPO partners into technical hiring workflows and ensuring the quality and efficiency of technical talent delivery.
Facilitate working sessions with technical recruiting teams and engineering hiring managers to identify process improvement opportunities specific to engineering hiring challenges and candidate experience.

Were excited about you because...

You have a minimum of 7-10 years of experience in program management or strategy & operations, with a significant and demonstrable focus on technical talent acquisition or recruitment operations for large-scale engineering organizations.
You possess a proven track record of driving process improvement and implementing strategic initiatives within a high-growth tech environment, specifically impacting engineering hiring outcomes.
You demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with advanced experience in data modeling, statistical analysis, and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, SQL) specific to technical recruiting metrics. You can translate complex technical hiring data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for engineering leadership.
You have deep expertise with ATS (e.g., Greenhouse, Workday), CRM (e.g., Beamery, Gem), and other recruiting technologies, with specific experience in tools used for technical assessments, coding challenges, and candidate relationship management for engineering talent. You also have a foundational understanding of Lean Six Sigma methodologies applied to talent acquisition processes.
You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong stakeholder relationships across engineering, product, and technical recruiting teams, influencing and collaborating effectively at all levels.

We expect this position to be filled by 9/26/2025.

Title: Associate Manager, Sales Enablement, Enterprise
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Sales Enablement team, under the Sales Strategy & Operations organization, enables the productivity of our sales and go-to-market organizations through alignment with capital OKRs and a 360-degree enablement strategy that encompasses activation across process, product, skill, GTM strategy and tooling. Through partnerships with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Operations, we design and deliver critical enablement programs that activate the business to drive sales performance and contribute to DoorDashs overall success.
About the Role
As an Associate Manager of Sales Enablement, you will play a hands-on role in executing enablement programs for DoorDashs Enterprise Restaurant, New Verticals, and Ads & Promos sales teams. You will work under the guidance of senior enablement leaders to coordinate logistics, prepare enablement materials, and ensure the smooth rollout of trainings and product launches.
Your responsibilities will focus on delivering enablement initiatives, maintaining training content, supporting sales onboarding, and providing day-to-day operational support to ensure sellers have the tools and information they need to be successful. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys managing details, and wants to contribute directly to program execution and seller readiness.
You are excited about this opportunity because...

Execute enablement plans and training initiatives for Enterprise Restaurant, New Verticals, and Ads & Promos sales teams in collaboration with team leads.
Manage the creation, organization, and distribution of enablement content including playbooks, presentations, and onboarding materials.
Support sales onboarding by coordinating scheduling, resources, and tools for new hire ramp-up.
Assist in preparing the field for product launches and GTM campaigns by helping deploy resources and training.
Partner with stakeholders to gather feedback and make updates to enablement materials to ensure accuracy and relevance.
Maintain internal enablement systems, documentation, and reporting to track program participation and performance.
Collaborate with peers to promote consistency in tools and messaging across teams, while staying flexible to the unique needs of each vertical.

Were excited about you because...

You have 45 years of experience in sales enablement, sales operations, or go-to-market rolespreferably supporting Enterprise or Strategic Sales teams.
You have demonstrated success in supporting enablement initiatives that drive measurable improvements in sales productivity.
You are experienced working in cross-functional environments and can manage multiple priorities across stakeholders.

You have strong project coordination skills, with an eye for detail and a passion for driving execution.
Youre comfortable using platforms like Salesforce, Outreach, Cornerstone, and other sales enablement tools.
You have a collaborative mindset and are eager to contribute to strategic initiatives while gaining exposure to leadership opportunities.

About the Team
We're looking for someone to help scale DoorDash's next billion dollar business, DashMart, by growing our in-house food program, DashMart Kitchens. The DashMart Kitchens team is focused on building a new type of restaurant platform within DashMart, offering a broad selection of prepared foods and well-known restaurant staples to our customers' doorsteps.
About the Role
We're looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Associate to join the Culinary Selection team within DashMart Kitchens (DMK). In this role, youll analyze brand and menu performance data, identifying opportunities to improve our menu selection and generating insights on customer preferences and selection gaps. Your work will directly inform how we evolve our culinary concepts, develop new menu items, and make data-driven decisions to better serve our customers.
This is a highly cross-functional role in which you will collaborate directly with our Culinary Development and Growth Marketing teams, supporting efforts to launch and scale high-performing menus and contributing to the overall success of our portfolio of brands.
If youre passionate about food, eager to work at the intersection of data and creativity, and excited to build a strong foundation in strategy and analysis, wed love to hear from you.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Analyze. You'll assess the operational and financial performance of the DashMart Kitchens portfolio and iterate based on data-driven insights.
Lead. You'll work with multiple teams, including R&D, kitchen operations, learning & development, supply chain, and growth to scale this line of business for DoorDash.

You're excited to be creative on how you work through problems.

You have completed your BS/BA Degree.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The mission of our Retention Marketing team is to build lasting relationships with our audiences  consumers, dashers, and/or merchants  as soon as they engage with DoorDash by providing them with a personalized, cross-channel experience that delights them and drives them to return to DoorDash to find the products and experiences that are relevant to them.
About the Role
We are looking to bring on a strategic, solution-oriented, and creative retention marketer to join the New Verticals retention team. In this role, you will focus on launching and maintaining CRM programs that help drive growth and retention for DoorDash during seasonal moments & holidays, or Occasions  think everything from Easter to a month-long winter holidays campaign. You will define and own business metrics, and collaborate with all parts of the business to create CRM campaigns that drive growth to DoorDash during key consumer moments. 
Key areas of support include: creating and maintaining campaigns & workflow strategy for occasional efforts, including offer, cadence, and audience testing; analyzing the impact of initiatives on key business metrics like order rate rate and revenue;  creative ideation & iteration, including creative optimization w/ the help of internal creative resources; consulting and overseeing strategy for various Cx workstreams. In this role, you will collaborate with all parts of the business (strategy & operations, brand, product marketing, analytics) and with our Retention team to create and execute strategies that engage and retain active customers on emerging lines of business at DoorDash. 
You will report to our New Verticals + Occasions Lead on our Consumer Lifecycle Marketing team within our Growth Marketing organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Responsible for creating CRM strategies to engage and retain Customers during seasonal moments
Create detailed customer journey flows with actionable trigger points with both static and dynamic content to drive conversion and engagement
Work closely with the Integrated Marketing function to develop campaign strategy briefs based on business needs and audience behavior, determining the best channel mix, audience targeting, and number of touchpoints per program 
Partner with Marketing Ops counterparts who are responsible for campaign build, QA, & launch 
Establish a strong working relationship with cross functional stakeholders in our Creative Studio, Promo Strategy, Product, Operations, Analytics, and Strategy teams
Work with Lifecycle Marketing Managers to increase personalization and relevance within audience lifecycle
Manage email reporting dashboards, monitor trends, and make recommendations based on results
Stay current on marketing best practices in email, push and SMS and share learnings and insights regularly with the broader marketing team

Were excited about you because you have...

4+ years experience in CRM or email marketing
Deep familiarity with CRM technology including ESPs/marketing automation platforms
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail
Strong writer and communicator
Basic knowledge of SQL, HTML and data visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, Periscope)
Knowledge of email industry best practices including contact strategies, targeting and segmentation, A/B testing, and analytics.
Extremely organized, dependable, self-motivated & ability to multi-task
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll manage a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, the local warehouse operating team, and be responsible for ensuring we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Recruit, lead, coach & retain a high-performing team of Shift Leads (3+) and Operations Associates (6+). Set your team up for success to work safely and productively. As a leader, you will be responsible for building a strong, positive culture and will be accountable for driving strong employee satisfaction scores. Work cross-functionally with central teams including our inventory and training teams to provide your team with the tools and resources to achieve this goal.

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 10+ employees
You act like an owner. You do what it takes to support a 24/7 business across multiple shifts. Youre excited to have ownership over a new and rapidly growing business.
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking

You have 3+ years of experience managing a team

DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Market Competitive pay

Title: Shift Lead - Downtown
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Benefits

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Title: Manager, Trust & Safety Communications
Location: San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA; Seattle, WA; Chicago, IL; New York, NY; Washington, DC; Phoenix, AZ
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Communications team tells the story of how DoorDash empowers local economies by connecting customers to the best of their communities. The team is a collaborative group with important partners, touching every corner of the organization. A roll-up-your-sleeves attitude, meticulous attention to detail, and out-of-the-box thinking, coupled with a true team spirit and the ability to juggle projects and priorities, are what makes this group so effective. A role on this team will require expertise in media relations, policy communications, and issues management.
About the Role
As the Manager of Trust & Safety Communications, youll lead proactive storytelling and rapid response around some of the most important and challenging issues at DoorDash. From highlighting our ongoing safety efforts to managing high-stakes media inquiries, this role sits at the intersection of narrative building and issues management. Youll partner closely with teams across Trust & Safety, Product, Strategy & Operations, Marketing, Policy, Legal, and Engineering to shape and share our safety story, while driving core reactive strategies across earned, owned, and social channels. If youre a strategic thinker and problem solver who thrives in fast-paced environments, this role is for you.
Your day to day might look like...

Developing and executing a communications strategy to launch a suite of new products aimed at making dashing safer
Managing responses to media inquiries about trust and safety incidents, including escalating and investigating with cross-functional partners 
Researching and establishing brand new partnerships with relevant safety organizations to help tell better stories at the local level 
Closely monitoring conversations about the DoorDash brand on social platforms and escalating if something starts to go viral 
Brainstorming creative responses to issues and crises across social and earned media platforms

Were excited about you because...

You have 5+ years experience in trust and safety communications, crisis management or public affairs. 
You have experience working in fast-paced, fluid and challenging environments, and are preferably familiar with the tech space and related issues. 
You have a deep understanding of the media and what makes a story, and a proven record of successfully managing journalists and shaping stories. 
You are digital and social-savvy, and have experience managing and responding to crises on social media. 
You are a strong writer and able to distill complex issues into clear, easy-to-understand messages. 
You have excellent people and project management skills, with the ability to lead and manage multiple time-sensitive projects under tight deadlines.
Youre a self-starter, intrinsically motivated, detail oriented, and also a good teammate.
You take your work, but not yourself, seriouslyand maintain a good sense of humor about both.

The Performance Excellence team is transforming how DoorDash measures and improves quality. Were building a scalable, automated QA system that delivers real-time insight into every customer interactionpowering faster decisions, better coaching, and a safer experience for customers, Dashers, and merchants. Weve proven success in support and are now expanding our quality coverage into high-impact domains like Fraud, Integrity, and Risk.
About the Role
As Manager, QA Strategy & Expansion, youll lead cross-functional initiatives to bring structured QA systems into new, complex parts of the business. This is a structured generalist role, ideal for someone who excels at driving clarity, building programs from scratch, and working across technical and non-technical teams. Youll also influence the QA tech roadmap to ensure were investing in the right tools and infrastructure for scale.

Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead strategic initiatives to expand QA systems into new areas like Fraud, Integrity, and Risk
Partner with Product, Operations, ML, and Engineering teams to define requirements and deliver scalable, high-impact quality programs
Help shape the long-term QA tech roadmap and prioritize key investments in automation and infrastructure
Bring clarity and structure to ambiguous problems, aligning stakeholders and driving execution end-to-end
Build systems, workflows, and documentation that make new QA capabilities measurable, actionable, and sustainable

Were excited about you because...

You have 6+ years of experience in generalist roles such as program management, strategy, operations, or product ops
Youre a structured thinker who thrives in ambiguity and can turn vision into execution
Youve led cross-functional programs that span technical and business teams
You bring strong analytical and project management skills, with a bias for clarity, impact, and velocity

Youre passionate about building systems that improve quality, trust, and performance at scale

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build  Youll have your fingerprints all over DoorDashs next big business. Youll do whatever it takes to launch, get 1% better every day, and scale something completely new. This means everything from high-level strategy to nitty-gritty operational details.
Strategize  From first principles, youll develop the optimal strategy for best serving our customers. 
Grow  Youll develop tactics and experiments to grow awareness (on and off our app) and trials of new products in partnership with Marketing, Merchandising, Product, and Analytics teams.
Experiment - Youll transform strategies into operational experiments that create measurable and actionable outcomes, informing your larger initiative implementation plans.
Analyze  Analyze. Youll assess the operational and financial impacts of your decisions, and iterate based on data.

Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst, Threat Defense
RoleDescription:
About the Team
At DoorDash, we are building the industry's most scalable and reliable delivery network, securing the data and protecting the privacy of our consumers, merchants, and dashers. Our Threat Defense team, encompassing Threat Response, Threat Hunting, Threat Intelligence, and Detection Engineering, is crucial to this mission. We are a fast-paced, highly collaborative group committed to innovation, proactive defense, and understanding the evolving threat landscape. Our ultimate goal is to create a secure DoorDash environment through proactive threat preparation and rapid response, safeguarding our people, partners, customers, and technologies with unwavering vigilance.
About the Role
The Threat Intelligence Analyst will be a foundational member of the Threat Defense Team and integral component of the Cyber Defense | Security Organization. As a Threat Intelligence Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of DoorDash's defensive capabilities, responsible for identifying, analyzing, and disseminating critical threat information. You'll proactively monitor the external threat landscape, track emerging attack vectors, and assess the potential impact on DoorDash. This role involves deep dives into threat actor methodologies, Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs), and campaigns, translating raw intelligence into actionable insights for our security teams.
You'll play a crucial role in enhancing our detection capabilities, informing our security posture, and ultimately safeguarding our ecosystem.
You will report into the Senior Manager, Threat Defense under the Director, Cyber Defense and Chief Information Security Officer.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Develop and execute operational and tactical threat intelligence requirements, leveraging a combination of open source and proprietary intelligence.
Maintain up to date knowledge of global security trends and the latest cyber threats in order to identify and assess threats to the company.
Prepare and deliver threat intelligence products to cross-functional partners and senior stakeholders.
Work with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.
Solve complex problems and think critically.

Were excited about you because...

4+ years of experience in a dedicated threat intelligence role.
A strong understanding of cyber threat intelligence lifecycle and frameworks (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK, Kill Chain).
Proficiency in collecting, analyzing, and synthesizing threat data from various sources (OSINT, commercial feeds, dark web forums).
Experience with threat intelligence platforms and security information and event management (SIEM) systems. Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and automation is a plus.
Ability to articulate complex technical information clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Title: Warehouse Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs is an independent team within DoorDash. We are working on building robotic and automation solutions as part of DoorDash's core delivery platform. If you have a passion for automation and robotics solutions in a service used by millions of people, then we want to talk to you!
About the Role
Were hiring a Warehouse Manager to oversee all warehouse operations for a growing portfolio of hardware devices that support DoorDashs core initiatives. In this role, youll lead deployment and return logistics for hardware across our network. Youll work cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Support, and Field Operations to ensure that devices are shipped quickly, returned efficiently, and tracked accurately through their full lifecycle.
You will own the tools, people, and processes that power this physical operation. From day-to-day warehouse throughput to strategic system design, you'll be responsible for building scalable, auditable, and cost-effective operations from the ground up.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Play a foundational role on a small and focused team shaping the future of hardware logistics at DoorDash
Lead all hardware deployments from request to fulfillment, ensuring SLA targets are met
Design and manage a reliable return and refurbishment program, from intake to redeployment
Implement and manage inventory tracking systems to ensure 100% device traceability
Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Support, and Field Ops teams to align warehouse execution with operational goals
Build and train a small warehouse operations team while standardizing processes and documentation
Select and optimize tools for shipping, inventory, and operational tracking
Provide operational feedback and surface trends to upstream teams to improve products and service

Were excited about you because...

You have 4+ years of experience managing warehouse operations, ideally for a hardware, logistics, or tech company
You excel at building and scaling physical processes with a systems-thinking mindset
You have hands-on experience with inventory management tools, barcode tracking, and logistics software
Youre an independent problem-solver who thrives in ambiguity and startup-like environments
Youre a strong people leader, capable of training and motivating warehouse teams
You are detail-oriented, with a high bar for accuracy and a drive to continuously improve
You communicate clearly across functions  from field techs to product engineers
